questions.text: A ________ is a mental representation of some object, event, or pattern.
“Characteristic features” and “family resemblance” are important aspects of the _________ view of concepts.
If “soda” is a basic-level category, then ______ would be a subordinate level.
According to the ______ view of concepts, people categorize new instances by comparing them to representations of previously stored instances.
The _____ view of concepts argues that concepts include representations of at least some individual instances and not only abstract summaries.
Which of the following is true regarding schemata?
options: A schema refers to something smaller and more specific than a concept.
Schemata are passive rather than active.
A schema contains only fixed parts, never variables.
Schemata can indicate relationships among various pieces of information.
questions.correctAnswer: Schemata can indicate relationships among various pieces of information.

questions.text: The ______ view of concepts argues that a person uses his/her theories about the way the world works to justify the classification of instances in the same category.
The schema view of concept formation assumes that:
options: there are clear boundaries among individual schemata.
there is cognitive economy among concepts.
no information is stored about actual instances.

questions.text: Which of the following is a good example of a basic level of categorization?
If “sandwich” is a basic-level category, then ______ would be a superordinate level.
